column5: We had planned to go for lake trout yesterday and i met up with Steve and Jerimiah from Manotak lodge.We unloaded and headed iut on the lake about 3 miles and half of it was slush.At our spot we had a hard time starting a brand new auger and when it did start it had no power but after a while we did get 3 holes drilled.We had zero action in that spot.Fished from 9-12.Didnt want to move and start over with that auger.Si only can report on ice conditions.Around a foot still and slushy.haha.But we solved a lot if the world problems.

Sounds like a stiff drink was needed after that day,that's the one reason I got rid of my bearcat I got tired of fighting the slush up there sometimes worked all day trying to get unstuck,hope I don't get stuck driving right up to the front door of Clark's ice shack
All 3 sleds are mountain sleds,so no problems.I didnt even know i was in slush till the other 2 guys told me.haha. No problems getting to the shack ever.
Sounds good John,glad to hear you didn't have to stand in 3ft of slush trying to get unstuck,it can be a nightmare that stuff,rod
Run a 800 polaris with a 155 "track and 2 1/4" paddles.its like a jet ski in water.

Went ice shack yesterday ron.redeemed myself.caught a lotcof walleye and probably lost one of the biggest walleyes ive ever seen.tried earlier around 2 was slow for first hour but hooked into the big girl right away higher up in the water column.then around 3 the bite really started but ended within a hr.probably caught around 25 or so.all on a 1/8 oz white marabou jig.toward end i was picking up one here and there on a straight hook.walleye dinner tonight.
Man you know how to get a guy pumped up,I have to settle for pizza tonight,but I will make up for it when I'm there,eye for lunch n dinner lol,rod
Just wondering about ice conditions as you hit the various lakes. Is the thickness less than a "normal" year? A foot doesn't seem like a lot. Tom

The walleye lakes are all 16+".its always the deep trout lakes that freeze slow.we have quite a bit if snow cover niw so that will slow making more ice.weather still mild but its pretty normal for ice rìght now.it will still slowly build some more if weather gets colder but snow is a good insulator.
Might add with the heavy snowload it creates lots of pressure which cracks ice and water leaks out creating slush which we have a lot of right now.
